subSubSection.paragraph: The species lives in old parks and ancient woodlands. It is found under the preferably dead bark of trees such as poplar, willow, oak, beech, walnut, chestnut, and maritime pine trees. It sometimes lives associated with ants such as Lasius fuliginosus and Formica cunicularia . The larva is a predator of other insect larvae and is often found in the burrows of Bostrychus sp. and Crypturgus pusillus . The adult appears in the spring and at the end of summer ( Alexander 2002 , Vienna 1980 ).
